## Supply Arrangement (SA) Solicitation for Truck, Tractor, and Heavy Medium Vehicles
### Reference Number: WS3987424970-Doc3991340433

The Government of Canada is issuing a Supply Arrangement (SA) solicitation to procure truck, tractor, and heavy medium vehicles for various requirements across Canada. The solicitation, listed under reference number WS3987424970-Doc3991340433, seeks to establish SAs for the provision of the following:

* Group 1: Heavy-duty trucks, tractors, and related equipment
* Group 2: Dump trucks, spreader units, and heavy-duty trucks
* Group 3: Mid-range trucks, including different configurations and specifications

### Amendment Information

The tender was amended on July 7, 2023, changing the closing time for submission of supporting documentation and SAs. Suppliers must now submit their responses on or before June 15, 2028, by 2:00 PM Eastern Daylight Time (EDT). SAs submitted after this deadline will be considered non-responsive.

### Procurement Details

* Tender Closing Date: June 15, 2028, at 2:00 PM EDT
* Procurement Method: Competitive, Open Bidding
* Trade Agreements: Suppliers must comply with the following trade agreements:
	+ Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA)
	+ Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
	+ North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA)
	+ Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
	+ Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
	+ Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
	+ World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
	+ Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
	+ Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
	+ Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
	+ Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
	+ Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
* Suppliers must include supporting documentation and transmit their arrangements electronically using SAP Ariba.

### Important Notes

* The Government of Canada is looking for suppliers who can provide vehicles for delivery to various locations across Canada, including areas subject to Comprehensive Land Claims Agreements (CLCAs).
* Suppliers may submit arrangements for one, two, or all three groups, as long as they submit an arrangement for each item in all Configurations within the group for which an arrangement is submitted
